posts.name: Deniz ≈ûenkul
posts.cooked: Recently we have been trying out using the SRX mag absolute encoders connected through the sparkmax motor controller but have failed to get any value from the encoder. The code seems to be fine and we even checked the REV Hardware Client which shows no change on the absolute duty cycle encoders. We have also tried the getAbsoluteEncoder() and the getAlternateEncoder() methods but to no avail. What may be causing the encoders to not give any position or velocity value?

link_counts.title: SRX Mag Encoder connection to Spark Max with Neo Motor

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked:
The SRX Mag Encoder‚Äôs PWM Duty Cycle output is on pin 9 (page 6 on the users guide)

The PWM Duty Cycle Input on the SparkMax is on pin 6

I haven‚Äôt tried to hook up an SRX Mag Encoder‚Äôs Duty Cycle output to a SparkMax myself yet, but assuming your SparkMax has Firmware 1.6.0 or newer, you should be able to use getAbsoluteEncoder() to use it after making a wiring harness that connects Pin 9 of the SRX Mag encoder to Pin 6 of the SparkMax Data Port.

posts.name: Deniz ≈ûenkul
posts.cooked: Thanks a lot for the help. Correcting the PWM port connection fixed our problem, as for the code the getAbsoluteEncoder() method now returns the expected values.

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: Glad to hear it since 3468 is planning to do similar this week! (Why I knew this off the top of my head) Would you mind sharing what you did for the wiring change? I‚Äôve been considering everything from soldering a jumper on a Mag Encoder directly (since nothing is connected to pin 6 according to user guide) to a custom cable.

posts.name: Deniz ≈ûenkul
posts.cooked: Currently we have only tested with a temporary connection between the VCC, ground and PWM pins using jumper cables inserted on a ribbon cable, but the jumper cables spread the ribbon cables. I‚Äôll update you once we fully connect all the encoders and do a full test on the connection .

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked:
This adapter board is designed to make it easier to use ARM dev boards that use slimmer 2x5 (0.05"/1.27mm pitch) SWD cables for programming. ¬†It's helpful for using products  ...

Price: $2.95 USD

Tic the ‚ÄúAlso include‚Äù box and you‚Äôre good to go.  These are small, a good form factor, and cheap ‚Äì there are other (similar) options, but this is a good choice.  You need to connect three sets of pins: +5V, GND, and the PWM line.  For connecting SRX Mag Encoder to SPARK MAX, you will need two of these, back to back.  You can also use a REV breakout board and one of these.

Note that the labeling on these does not match the signals ‚Äì you need to pay attention to the pin numbers.

link_counts.title: SWD (2x5 1.27mm) Cable Breakout Board : ID 2743 : $2.95 : Adafruit Industries, Unique & fun DIY electronics and kits

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: Oh yeah, another thing to add, mostly for those who may happen across this later down the line since this topic specifies Brushed motors, you will want to make sure you don‚Äôt connect pins 5 and 7 from the SRX Mag Encoder to the SparkMax if using a NEO, as these are the Quadrature Encoder inputs which would interfere with the the NEO‚Äôs integrated encoder.
